info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 18 at 12:13AM EDT until June 18 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following county, Smyth.
* WHEN...Until 300 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1208 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to occur within the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen between Marion and Chilhowie. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain on top of what has already fallen will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marion...Saltville...Chilhowie...Adwolf... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING
